revised_title: The Jumping Mechanism of Xenopsylla Cheopis: Exoskeletal Structures and Musculature
tldr: The article describes the jumping mechanism of the flea Xenopsylla Cheopis, focusing on its exoskeletal structures and musculature. The authors explain the various specializations of the exoskeleton that stiffen the thorax and provide the 'click' mechanism triggering take-off. They also discuss the importance of the link-plates in aligning hook and socket devices and describe the muscles involved in the flea's jump.
